ISellerAuth.AuthResponse,[object Object].description:
Response object for a successful seller sign-out (logout) operation. Indicates end of JWT session and provides operation status message for the client. Does not include any sensitive information or authentication tokens.

Fields:
- success: Boolean indicating that the logout operation completed successfully.
- message: Optional string (may be null) with a human-readable status confirmation of sign-out.

Intended for consumption by frontend clients to provide user feedback after logging out.

success.description: Indicates whether the logout operation was successful (true on normal sign-out).

oneOf.description: Optional status message to confirm completion of sign out, suitable for UI (e.g., 'Logout successful.'). May be null if not provided.
Optional status message to confirm completion of sign out, suitable for UI (e.g., 'Logout successful.'). May be null if not provided.

message.description: Optional status message to confirm completion of sign out, suitable for UI (e.g., 'Logout successful.'). May be null if not provided.

data.description: List of system setting record summaries.

IShoppingMallAiBackendSystemSetting.IReq.description: Paginated result containing a list of system setting summaries and pagination info.

IShoppingMallAiBackendAppeal.ICreate,[ob.description: Schema for updating a submitted appeal (objection) to a moderation event. Only selected fields can be updated (status, decision_comment). Used by authorized actors (admin or the submitting user) to respond to, resolve, or clarify an appeal. Ensures audit/compliance of reasoning behind status changes and final verdict.

status.description: Appeal status (one of: 'pending', 'under review', 'approved', 'rejected', etc.). Updates business workflow and enables decision tracking.

oneOf.description: Rationale or explanation for the appeal decision, set by the reviewer/admin when resolving or updating the record.
Rationale or explanation for the appeal decision, set by the reviewer/admin when resolving or updating the record.

decision_comment.description: Rationale or explanation for the appeal decision, set by the reviewer/admin when resolving or updating the record.

data.description: Array of product-channel mapping summary or full records.

IShoppingMallAiBackendProductChannelMap..description: Paginated, filterable container for an array of product-channel mapping results.

id.description: The unique identifier for this coupon usage record.

order_id.description: ID of the order where coupon was redeemed.

customer_id.description: ID of customer who used the coupon.

IPageIShoppingMallAiBackendCouponUsage.I.description:
A summary view of coupon usage, designed to be returned in lists and paged responses.

Includes identifying fields for the coupon usage, related issued coupon, linked order and customer, and the timestamp of usage.
Useful for reporting, audit, and administrative overviews.

data.description: Array of cart snapshot resource records for the current page.

IShoppingMallAiBackendCartSnapshot.IRequ.description: Paginated response object for shopping cart snapshots. Includes pagination info and the result set.

IShoppingMallAiBackendCoinBalance.IReque.description: Paginated collection of coin balance records, including pagination meta fields (current page, total pages/data, etc.) and a list of coin balance objects. Used in all list/search/index endpoints for coin wallet balances.

oneOf.description: Optional note or reason to add or update for the point history event. Used for audit/correction.
Optional note or reason to add or update for the point history event. Used for audit/correction.

remarks.description: Optional note or reason to add or update for the point history event. Used for audit/correction.

IShoppingMallAiBackendPointHistory.ICrea.description: DTO for updating a point history event. Only remarks (note/description) is generally updatable. All other fields are immutable after creation.

email.description: Unique email identifier for admin registration in shopping_mall_ai_backend_admins. Required and must follow business format/policy.

password.description: Plaintext password for registration (will be hashed to password_hash in DB), must meet compliance criteria.

ICustomerChangePassword.Response,[object.description: Admin registration input payload—shopping_mall_ai_backend_admins. Required to create new admin (super/admin/operator/auditor, etc.) account. Only includes minimal credential fields for registration endpoint; additional business/profile fields are handled elsewhere after registration.

customer_id.description: UUID of the owning customer from shopping_mall_ai_backend_customers.

wallet_program.description: Mileage or loyalty program code (e.g., 'brand', 'event', 'affiliate'). Must align with business/marketing program definition.

wallet_status.description: Initial status of the wallet. E.g., 'active'.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Admin/user-display label for the wallet.
(Optional) Admin/user-display label for the wallet.
(Optional) PIN, credential, or authentication code for wallet operation. Null if unused.
(Optional) PIN, credential, or authentication code for wallet operation. Null if unused.

security_code.description: (Optional) PIN, credential, or authentication code for wallet operation. Null if unused.

IShoppingMallAiBackendMileageWallet,[obj.description: Payload for creating a mileage wallet for a customer. Requires customer ID, program type, and wallet status; label and security info are optional.

id.description: Unique onboarding history record identifier to be updated.

step_status.description: New step_status value to set (e.g., completed, failed, need_revision, etc.).

oneOf.description: (Optional) Admin identifier (UUID) who has just approved this step, if applicable.
(Optional) Admin identifier (UUID) who has just approved this step, if applicable.

approved_by.description: (Optional) Admin identifier (UUID) who has just approved this step, if applicable.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Description or context for the update (reason, next action, etc.).
(Optional) Description or context for the update (reason, next action, etc.).

note.description: (Optional) Description or context for the update (reason, next action, etc.).

IShoppingMallAiBackendSellerOnboarding,[.description: Fields required or permitted to update a seller onboarding event record. Used for PATCH/PUT. Only mutable fields included.

data.description: Array of favorite address records for the result page.

IShoppingMallAiBackendFavoriteAddress.IR.description: Paginated result for favorite addresses. Follows IPage<T> container pattern.

id.description: Unique primary key for this order group (UUID).

group_name.description: Name or label for the order group (e.g., batch job, partner, or channel naming).

oneOf.description: Optional external key or integration reference—for partners or settlements. Nullable.
Optional external key or integration reference—for partners or settlements. Nullable.

external_reference.description: Optional external key or integration reference—for partners or settlements. Nullable.

oneOf.description: Optional JSON-encoded metadata for partner, batch, settlement, or automation context. Nullable.
Optional JSON-encoded metadata for partner, batch, settlement, or automation context. Nullable.

meta_info.description: Optional JSON-encoded metadata for partner, batch, settlement, or automation context. Nullable.

oneOf.description: Soft delete timestamp if group is deleted. Null if active.
Soft delete timestamp if group is deleted. Null if active.

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp if group is deleted. Null if active.

IPageIShoppingMallAiBackendOrderGroup,[o.description:
Represents an order group (batch) entity for business batch operations, integrations, and settlements. Contains group identity, references, meta information, and audit fields.

Links to multiple orders for processing and compliance.

product_id.description: The product this keyword relates to. Required. References shopping_mall_ai_backend_products.id.

search_keyword.description: The search keyword to assign to the product. Required. Used for product discoverability in search and UX improvement.

IShoppingMallAiBackendProductSearchKeywo.description: DTO for creating a new search keyword entry associated with a product. Follows the required fields in shopping_mall_ai_backend_product_search_keywords schema. Omits ID as it is generated by the system.

issued_coupon_id.description: Reference to the associated issued coupon's id, for filtering histories by coupon.

actor_id.description: ID of the actor (admin/customer) who performed the action, for search or filter. Nullable filter.

actor_type.description: Type of actor (e.g. customer, admin, seller) who performed the action.

action.description: Business event performed on the coupon (issued, used, expire, cancel, system, etc).

action_at_from.description: Start filter of action occurrence timestamp range.

action_at_to.description: End filter of action occurrence timestamp range.

page.description: Page number for pagination. Starts at 1.

limit.description: Number of records per page for pagination.

sort.description: Sorting order (by allowed fields, e.g. action_at desc/asc).

IShoppingMallAiBackendIssuedCoupon.IUpda.description: Request type for listing/searching coupon histories (audit/event records). Supports filtering by issued_coupon_id, actor, action, date range, pagination, and sorting.

event_type.description: Type of compliance event (as per compliance taxonomy). Examples: 'policy_update', 'data_erasure_request', etc.

oneOf.description: ID of the actor (user/admin/subsystem) who triggered the event, or null for automated/system events.
ID of the actor (user/admin/subsystem) who triggered the event, or null for automated/system events.

actor_id.description: ID of the actor (user/admin/subsystem) who triggered the event, or null for automated/system events.

actor_type.description: The actor type (admin/customer/seller/subsystem/other), required for auditability and polymorphic trace.

target_type.description: The target entity type affected by the compliance event (such as 'customer', 'order', 'product', table name, etc.).

oneOf.description: UUID of the affected entity, or null if the event is system-wide/global.
UUID of the affected entity, or null if the event is system-wide/global.

target_id.description: UUID of the affected entity, or null if the event is system-wide/global.

oneOf.description: Arbitrary (optionally JSON) structured payload for evidence—may include snapshot state, reasons, or payload for compliance event initiation.
Arbitrary (optionally JSON) structured payload for evidence—may include snapshot state, reasons, or payload for compliance event initiation.

event_payload.description: Arbitrary (optionally JSON) structured payload for evidence—may include snapshot state, reasons, or payload for compliance event initiation.

IShoppingMallAiBackendComplianceEvent,[o.description: Request schema for creating a compliance event. This object MUST reference the type of event, actor, target entity, and can include payload for business and regulatory context. All required fields must match compliance record policies.

data.description: List of product records for the current result page.

IShoppingMallAiBackendProduct.IRequest,[.description: Paginated product result structure. 'pagination' provides detailed page info and 'data' contains result product records.

owner_id.description: UUID of the entity that owns the attachment (e.g., product, admin, order). Used for filtering attachments by ownership.

owner_type.description: Type/classification of the owner (e.g., 'admin', 'seller', 'product', 'order', etc.). Used for polymorphic business context search.

file_name.description: Attachment file name, partial match or exact as search. Used for filtering.

mime_type.description: MIME type of attachments to search (e.g., 'image/png').

storage_uri.description: Filter by file storage URI or key substring.

uploaded_at_from.description: Lower bound datetime for uploaded_at filter.

uploaded_at_to.description: Upper bound datetime for uploaded_at filter.

expire_at_from.description: Lower bound datetime for file expiry filter.

expire_at_to.description: Upper bound datetime for file expiry filter.

created_at_from.description: Filter attachments created after this timestamp.

created_at_to.description: Filter attachments created before this timestamp.

deleted.description: If true, include soft-deleted attachments; otherwise only active.

page.description: Current page number for pagination; defaults to 1 if not set.

pageSize.description: Page size for pagination, limits results per page.

q.description: General search keyword applied to file name, description, or metadata for matching any content.

sort.description: Field name to use for sorting, e.g., 'uploaded_at', 'file_name'. Direction (asc/desc) can be specified as well.

IShoppingMallAiBackendChannelCategoryMap.description: Request payload for advanced, paginated filtering of system attachments. All properties are optional. At least one property should be specified for search.

id.description: The unique identifier (UUID) for this error log record.

error_code.description: Application-level error code string for this event.

error_message.description: Short summary or human-readable explanation of the error.

error_context.description: Detailed JSON blob or text describing the full technical/business context and stack/error details.

oneOf.description: Entity type (e.g., order, user) directly implicated as cause for this error log record, if any.
Entity type (e.g., order, user) directly implicated as cause for this error log record, if any.

root_cause_entity_type.description: Entity type (e.g., order, user) directly implicated as cause for this error log record, if any.

oneOf.description: Unique ID of the root cause entity if present.
Unique ID of the root cause entity if present.

root_cause_entity_id.description: Unique ID of the root cause entity if present.

severity_level.description: Severity of error (info, warning, error, critical, fatal).

occurred_at.description: ISO date-time when the error occurred.

IPageIShoppingMallAiBackendErrorLog.ISum.description: A detailed record of an error or exception event, including all application context for SRE/compliance debug. Represents one business/system error.

page.description: Pagination: page number. Defaults to 1 if omitted.

pageSize.description: Pagination: maximum number of results per page. Application may have limits (e.g., 10, 20, 50, 100).

order_number.description: Search by the business order number. Partial matches allowed.

customer_id.description: Filter orders belonging to a specific customer (UUID format).

status_in.description: Filter by a list of statuses.

total_amount_gte.description: Filter orders where total_amount is greater than or equal to this value.

total_amount_lte.description: Filter orders where total_amount is less than or equal to this value.

created_at_gte.description: Filter for orders created at or after this datetime (ISO 8601).

created_at_lte.description: Filter for orders created before or at this datetime (ISO 8601).

sort.description: Sort criteria as defined by application (e.g., '-created_at', 'total_amount').

IShoppingMallAiBackendProductContent.IUp.description: Request schema for searching or filtering orders. Designed for use in admin/seller/customer complex search or list scenarios.

id.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for the customer.

email.description: Customer's unique business email address used for authentication and notifications.

password_hash.description: Hashed value of the customer's login password. Sensitive; not exposed in responses.

name.description: Full name of the customer for verification and profile display.

nickname.description: Unique display nickname. Required for social, review, and community activities.

phone.description: Mobile phone number, for verification and contact.

oneOf.description: URI for the customer's profile image, used for UI display.
URI for the customer's profile image, used for UI display.

profile_image_uri.description: URI for the customer's profile image, used for UI display.

status.description: Account status (active, locked, dormant, withdrawn, etc.). Used for business access and state handling.

email_verified.description: Indicates whether the customer's email has been verified.

phone_verified.description: Indicates whether the customer's phone number has been verified.

oneOf.description: Most recent login datetime for the customer account.
Most recent login datetime for the customer account.

last_login_at.description: Most recent login datetime for the customer account.

created_at.description: Creation timestamp for this record (for auditing purposes).

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the most recent customer data update.

oneOf.description: Soft deletion timestamp, null means not deleted.
Soft deletion timestamp, null means not deleted.

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp, null means not deleted.

IPageIShoppingMallAiBackendCustomer.ISum.description: Customer account data. Records all registered users with personal details, account status, and audit fields. See Actors namespace; does not expose sensitive fields in API responses.

code.description: Unique short string code to reference/identify this section within a parent channel. Must be unique per channel and stable, as it may be used in automation or APIs.

name.description: Display name for the section (as seen in UI navigation, admin tools). Concise, human-friendly text.

oneOf.description: Business context or detailed information about the section. Example: 'Promotes top-selling items for summer campaign.' Nullable.
Business context or detailed information about the section. Example: 'Promotes top-selling items for summer campaign.' Nullable.

description.description: Business context or detailed information about the section. Example: 'Promotes top-selling items for summer campaign.' Nullable.

display_order.description: Order index of the section for UI and business displays. Lower values typically displayed first.

visible.description: Whether the section is visible (true) or hidden (false) in UI/API. Used to manage curation flows.

channel_id.description: Parent channel's UUID that this section is created under. Required to establish referential integrity.

created_by_admin_id.description: Admin user UUID who creates this section. Used for audit and permission management.

IShoppingMallAiBackendSection,[object Ob.description: Request body schema for creating a new channel section. Captures all required fields for insertion, including business context and curation logic. Must respect unique code per channel constraint. The section is established within a channel by the given admin.

IShoppingMallAiBackendReviewSnapshot,[ob.description: Request DTO for creating a new review snapshot. Used when persisting an immutable historical record of a review state in response to an update, moderation, or compliance event. All required fields from the review at the snapshot moment plus event context (actor, timestamp). Must be validated for all required business and audit properties. Properties must align with the review snapshot schema, as the business rules demand each snapshot be legally and technically valid for later traceability, rollback, and audit.

review_id.description: Product review entity being snapshotted, PK from product_reviews table.

body.description: Review body/content at time of snapshot. Must match original review rules.

rating.description: Review star rating at time of snapshot (numeric value, typically 1-5).

status.description: Workflow/business status for the review at the snapshot event.

actor_id.description: ID of user (customer/admin/seller) creating the snapshot.

oneOf.description: (Optional) AI sentiment score for this review at the snapshot point (may be null if unused).
(Optional) AI sentiment score for this review at the snapshot point (may be null if unused).

ai_sentiment_score.description: (Optional) AI sentiment score for this review at the snapshot point (may be null if unused).

oneOf.description: (Optional) AI spam score or similar for this review at the snapshot point (may be null if unused).
(Optional) AI spam score or similar for this review at the snapshot point (may be null if unused).

ai_spam_score.description: (Optional) AI spam score or similar for this review at the snapshot point (may be null if unused).

changed_at.description: Time when snapshot event occurred (ISO8601, required for evidence chain).

id.description:
Unique identifier of the customer history event.

References the `id` field in the shopping_mall_ai_backend_customer_histories table. Used for audit trails, rollback scenarios, and compliance evidence.

customer_id.description:
UUID of the customer to whom this history event refers.

References the parent customer account (`shopping_mall_ai_backend_customers.id`).

event_type.description:
Code or label describing the type of event (created, updated, password_changed, verified, locked, withdrawn, etc).

Business context is determined by this value. Used for filtering history types in audit and support scenarios.

oneOf.description:
Serialized JSON (nullable) of the prior state/fields for the customer before the event.

Used in audits, rollback, and compliance snapshot reconstruction.

Serialized JSON (nullable) of the prior state/fields for the customer before the event.

Used in audits, rollback, and compliance snapshot reconstruction.

old_value_json.description:
Serialized JSON (nullable) of the prior state/fields for the customer before the event.

Used in audits, rollback, and compliance snapshot reconstruction.

oneOf.description:
Serialized JSON (nullable) of the new/current state/fields for the customer after the event.

Allows diffs for audit, evidentiary logging, and compliance review.

Serialized JSON (nullable) of the new/current state/fields for the customer after the event.

Allows diffs for audit, evidentiary logging, and compliance review.

new_value_json.description:
Serialized JSON (nullable) of the new/current state/fields for the customer after the event.

Allows diffs for audit, evidentiary logging, and compliance review.

triggered_by.description:
String code indicating who or what triggered the event (user, admin, system, external, etc).

Used for workflow trace and compliance provenance.

oneOf.description:
Opaque JSON or string for additional context, e.g., IP address, device, channel, error codes, etc. Optional.

Used in security analysis, compliance, and detailed forensics.

Opaque JSON or string for additional context, e.g., IP address, device, channel, error codes, etc. Optional.

Used in security analysis, compliance, and detailed forensics.

meta_json.description:
Opaque JSON or string for additional context, e.g., IP address, device, channel, error codes, etc. Optional.

Used in security analysis, compliance, and detailed forensics.

occurred_at.description: Timestamp of when the history event occurred.

created_at.description: Timestamp when this history record was created.

IPageIShoppingMallAiBackendCustomerHisto.description:
Audit/history entity representing significant customer account lifecycle events (creation, profile changes, status transitions, password changes, verification, etc).

For each customer, the system records a chronological list of these entities as evidence and rollback traces. Sensitive data in `old_value_json`/`new_value_json` may be redacted in UI. Supports audit, compliance, security, and business intelligence.

rule_description.description: New or revised detailed English description of the rule/policy. Should explain the business and legal impact thoroughly.

enforcement_status.description: Current enforcement status of the policy. Should follow system's enum convention (active, draft, suspended, etc).

oneOf.description: Updated rationale or justification for the change to this policy/rule. Should assist audit review.
Updated rationale or justification for the change to this policy/rule. Should assist audit review.

reason_for_change.description: Updated rationale or justification for the change to this policy/rule. Should assist audit review.

effective_from.description: Timestamp for the new effective start date/time. UTC, ISO 8601.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Expiry date/time for the rule/policy. Null if open-ended.
(Optional) Expiry date/time for the rule/policy. Null if open-ended.

effective_to.description: (Optional) Expiry date/time for the rule/policy. Null if open-ended.

IShoppingMallAiBackendBusinessRule.ICrea.description: Data for updating an existing business rule or system policy. Must provide clear new values for compliance/auditing.

IShoppingMallAiBackendFavoriteNotificati.description: Request object for creating a new favorite notification event for a customer. Used to persist notification events triggered by favorite object changes. Must specify at least one favorite object reference, a notification type, channel, and initial read state (usually false). Delivery metadata is optional and accepted for advanced integrations. Used by system notification engines and business rule triggers. All references must validate ownership and existence according to the business domain.

oneOf.description: Product favorites component to notify about. Required if notification relates to a product. @format uuid or null.
Product favorites component to notify about. Required if notification relates to a product. @format uuid or null.

favorite_product_id.description: Product favorites component to notify about. Required if notification relates to a product. @format uuid or null.

oneOf.description: Inquiry favorites component to notify about. Required if notification relates to an inquiry. @format uuid or null.
Inquiry favorites component to notify about. Required if notification relates to an inquiry. @format uuid or null.

favorite_inquiry_id.description: Inquiry favorites component to notify about. Required if notification relates to an inquiry. @format uuid or null.

oneOf.description: Address favorites component to notify about. Required if notification relates to an address. @format uuid or null.
Address favorites component to notify about. Required if notification relates to an address. @format uuid or null.

favorite_address_id.description: Address favorites component to notify about. Required if notification relates to an address. @format uuid or null.

notification_type.description: Notification event type for business triggers (e.g., "RESTOCK", "PRICE_DROP", "INQUIRY_REPLY", "ADDRESS_CHANGED"). Must match supported event types.

notification_channel.description: Delivery channel for notification: "PUSH", "EMAIL", "SMS", etc. Should match system-allowed channels.

read.description: Initial read/unread state for the notification (usually false at creation).

oneOf.description: Optional structured JSON or text for advanced provider/context tracing, error or response data. Null if not present.
Optional structured JSON or text for advanced provider/context tracing, error or response data. Null if not present.

delivery_metadata.description: Optional structured JSON or text for advanced provider/context tracing, error or response data. Null if not present.

oneOf.description: The updated available stock of this option. If provided, must be a non-negative integer.
The updated available stock of this option. If provided, must be a non-negative integer.

stock_count.description: The updated available stock of this option. If provided, must be a non-negative integer.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Updated safety stock threshold—if this value is not changed, pass null or omit.
(Optional) Updated safety stock threshold—if this value is not changed, pass null or omit.

safety_stock.description: (Optional) Updated safety stock threshold—if this value is not changed, pass null or omit.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Updated inbound stock count. Set to null to remove pending inbound.
(Optional) Updated inbound stock count. Set to null to remove pending inbound.

inbound_count.description: (Optional) Updated inbound stock count. Set to null to remove pending inbound.

oneOf.description: (Optional) New or updated warehouse location/bin code.
(Optional) New or updated warehouse location/bin code.

warehouse_location.description: (Optional) New or updated warehouse location/bin code.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Updated business status for this stock record, such as 'active', 'reserved', etc.
(Optional) Updated business status for this stock record, such as 'active', 'reserved', etc.

status.description: (Optional) Updated business status for this stock record, such as 'active', 'reserved', etc.

IShoppingMallAiBackendProductOptionStock.description: DTO for updating product option stock records. All fields are optional (partial updates allowed). Only provided properties will be updated. Used for stock count changes, warehouse location updates, and status changes for the stock record.

IShoppingMallAiBackendOrderPaymentLog,[o.description: Request schema for creating a new payment log record for a specific order payment. Used when adding new log events to track technical/business milestones or events related to payment processing. Fields correspond directly to shopping_mall_ai_backend_order_payment_logs Prisma schema. Descriptions reference schema property meaning and audit/business function. All required fields must be present for correct creation.

log_type.description: Business/technical type of this payment log event. Defines what milestone, activity, or event this log entry represents. Acceptable values are 'request', 'response', 'error', or event names defined in the business rule. Must match shopping_mall_ai_backend_order_payment_logs.log_type policy.

log_context.description: Serialization of technical context, request/response data, error/debug stack, or business metadata. Can be plain text or JSON. Maps to shopping_mall_ai_backend_order_payment_logs.log_context. Should capture essential data for forensic, compliance, or debugging review.

occurred_at.description: Precise (UTC, RFC-3339) timestamp when the log event occurred. Used for audit trails and sequenced event forensic review. Maps to shopping_mall_ai_backend_order_payment_logs.occurred_at. Required for compliance.

IShoppingMallAiBackendOrderSnapshot.ICre.description: Request body for updating an existing order snapshot record. Only limited fields are mutable post-creation; generally for compliance correction or adding a clarified reason. Immutable fields such as order_id and snapshot_json are not updatable after creation.

snapshot_reason.description: Textual field for updating or providing a corrected/augmented reason for the snapshot (used for compliance annotation or admin audits).

IShoppingMallAiBackendProductInquiry.IUp.description: Request schema for searching, filtering, and paginating product inquiry snapshots. Used to find historical/point-in-time states for compliance, audit, or rollback purposes. Reference the Prisma schema's inquiry_snapshots entity for full meaning of each field.

inquiry_id.description: Target product inquiry ID (UUID) for which to filter snapshots.

actor_id.description: Filter snapshots by the actor (customer/admin/seller) UUID who made the change. Optional.

status.description: Filter by inquiry snapshot status at time of snapshot (e.g., 'waiting', 'answered', etc.).

changed_at_from.description: ISO 8601 date-time (inclusive) lower bound for snapshot timestamp.

changed_at_to.description: ISO 8601 date-time (inclusive) upper bound for snapshot timestamp.

page.description: Page number for pagination, starting from 1.

limit.description: Page size (number of records per page).

oneOf.description: Sort direction; only 'asc' or 'desc' is valid if sort_by is present.
Sort direction; only 'asc' or 'desc' is valid if sort_by is present.

sort_direction.description: Sort direction; only 'asc' or 'desc' is valid if sort_by is present.
